name: AndImageFilter
briefdescription: Implements the AND bitwise operator pixel-wise between two images.
detaileddescription:
This class is templated over the types of the two input images and the type of the output image. Numeric conversions (castings) are done by the C++ defaults.
Since the bitwise AND operation is only defined in C++ for integer types, the images passed to this filter must comply with the requirement of using integer pixel type.
The total operation over one pixel will beoutput_pixel=static_cast<OutputPixelType>(input1_pixel&input2_pixel)Where "&" is the bitwise AND operator in C++.
\par Wiki Examples:

\li All Examples
\li Binary AND two images
